item.description:
We've talked about starting matinee viewings on Sundays in the winter, and since this movie shows ONLY at 4:00pm, it seems a natural. From the museum's website:

"The Wildest Dream is an 'Everest Thrill Ride' according to Reuters. This 93-minute movie is a breath-taking exploration of Everest and one man’s obsessive quest to conquer the goliath mountain. George Mallory was obsessed with becoming the first person to conquer the untouched Mount Everest. Last seen 800 feet below the summit in 1924, the clouds rolled in and he disappeared into legend. 75 years later, climber Conrad Anker's returns to Everest to unravel the mysteries surrounding Mallory’s disappearance."

http://ctsciencecente...

You can go earlier and see the museum, or arrive just for the movie. There is a special movie-only price.

We may go to supper afterwards, and continue discussion of the film.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "The Wildest Dream" @ The Connecticut Science Center
